brief_summary.textblock:
Burnout patients show deficient working memory functioning. Several studies showed a
      training can increase working memory capacity. In the current study we explored whether
      training working memory can reduce burnout and burnout related symptoms and increase working
      memory capacity.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Working Memory Training in Burnout Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  undifferentiated somatoform disorder with a work related cause

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age which exceeded the range of 18 to 67 years

          -  a severe major depressive episode

          -  substance dependence or abuse

other_outcome.description: The Dutch version of the Symptom Checklist-90-Revised (Derogatis, 1977) is a 90-item self-report questionnaire which measures psychosocial distress of the last week - including the day of testing - on a 5-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely).
other_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom Checklist-90-Revised (SCL-90) score on pre and post training and two months after training
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post (4 weeks after baseline), after last session of cognitive behavioral therapy and follow-up (2 months after post-test)

other_outcome.description: The Digit Span consists of two parts with 14 trials each: the forward Digit Span measures short term memory, whereas the backward version measures WM.
other_outcome.measure: Change in Digit Span score on pre and post training and two months after training
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post (4 weeks after baseline), after last session of cognitive behavioral therapy and follow-up (2 months after post-test)

other_outcome.description: The Reading Span assesses the processing and storage functions of WM (Shipstead et al., 2012).
other_outcome.measure: Change in Reading Span partial-credit unit score on pre and post training and two months after training
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post (4 weeks after baseline), after last session of cognitive behavioral therapy and follow-up (2 months after post-test)

authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

primary_outcome.description: The Dutch translation of the Maslach Burnout Inventory - General Survey (Schaufeli, Leiter, Maslach, & Jackson, 1996), the Utrechtse Burnout Scale-A, measures the severity of burnout symptoms.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in Utrechtse Burnout Scale (UBOS) score on pre and post training and two months after training
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post (4 weeks after baseline), after last session of cognitive behavioral therapy and follow-up (2 months after post-test)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The Cognitive Failure Questionnarie measures the frequency of participants' experienced cognitive failures regarding memory, action, perception and attention.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive Failure Questionnaire (CFQ) score on pre and post training and two months after training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post (4 weeks after baseline), after last session of cognitive behavioral therapy and follow-up (2 months after post-test)
